content: the lively blanket crochet pattern by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful https //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy @prettypeacefulcrochet on instagram pretty peaceful on facebook pretty peaceful youtube video tutorials size 37 inches square 94 cm square yarn worsted weight medium category 4 2 skeins of red heart granny square all in one yarn 100% acrylic 417 yards 381 m per 250-gram skein that is 834 yards 762 meters of yarn the sample blanket used 2 skeins of red heart granny square all in one yarn in the soft white citrus twist colorway hook 8 mm us l11 gauge 11 5 stitches = 4 inches 10 cm 12 row = 4 inches 10 cm terms us chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook single_crochet single_crochet insert hook into stitch or space yarn over pull through stitch or space yarn over again pull through both loops on hook foundation single_crochet a method for beginning a project without having to make a separate row of chains first it creates a nice straight even starting edge here s a video tutorial by tamara kelly of mooglyblog com https //www mooglyblog com/foundation-single-crochet-fsc/ introduction and tutorial video for the lively blanket on youtube https //youtu be/kljnsgmbnue pattern notes you can make your blanket any size you want by adjusting the number of starting chains any odd number of starting chains works for this pattern the whole blanket uses moss stitch which is a repeating single_crochet chain 1 pattern moss stitch is sometimes called linen stitch add the second skein whenever the first skein runs out and don t worry if it starts on a different color go with the flow of color changes- no cutting or controlling of colors needed the lively blanket crochet pattern © 2023 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful row 1 chain 110 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and all chains across turn 109 single_crochet or foundation single_crochet 109 turn 109 single_crochet row 2 chain 2 counts as first single_crochet and chain 1 single_crochet in 3rd stitch from hook chain 1 skip next stitch single_crochet in next stitch 54 times working last single_crochet into last stitch of previous row turn 109 sts row 3 - 112 chain 2 single_crochet in first chain-1 space of previous row chain 1 single_crochet in next chain-1 space 52 times chain 1 skip last chain-1 space single_crochet into top of starting chain 2 from previous row turn 109 sts fasten_off and weave in ends to add a new skein or work around a knot i like to use the russian join method here is a video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=9mxt2mrr894 having trouble check out tamara kelly s video tutorials on her excellent crochet blog moogly she shows how to hold the yarn and hook how to make a slipknot how to make a chain and how to single_crochet http
